Dr. Susan Bassham was featured on Jefferson Public Radio discussing our groundbreaking research on rapid evolution in threespine stickleback!

In the segment "When Evolution Speeds Up," Susan eloquently explained how our Alaska stickleback research demonstrates that evolution can occur much faster than traditionally thought, with significant implications for understanding species' responses to environmental change.

## Radio Interview Highlights

Susan discussed:
- Evolution in decades, not millennia
- Alaska earthquake natural experiment
- Stickleback as evolutionary model
- Climate change implications
- Real-time adaptation
